message_1: How many ways can you choose 6 donuts from 4 different flavors if there are unlimited donuts of each flavor available?
message_2:
This is a problem of combinations with repetition (also known as multisets). We have 4 different flavors of donuts and we want to choose 6 donuts. We can use the formula for combinations with repetition:

C(n + r - 1, r) = C(n - 1, r - 1)

where n is the number of flavors (4) and r is the number of donuts we want to choose (6).

C(4 + 6 - 1, 6) = C(9, 6) = 9! / (6! * (9 - 6)!)

C(9, 6) = 9! / (6! * 3!) = 362880 / (720 * 6) = 84

So there are 84 ways to choose 6 donuts from 4 different flavors with unlimited donuts of each flavor available.
